website_summaries.verdict: There's nothing flashy about Anker's Soundcore Liberty Air true wireless earphones, but they deliver very strong audio performance, especially for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent earphones...with a dealbreaking connection bug
customer_reviews.text: Negative: Connection drops during calls after 10-20 seconds. I tried pairing again and resetting the earphones, no success. Also the Left sometimes does not connect at all. Returned. Positive: excellent sound for music. Very clear microphones (but you only have time to say 'hello' before connection drops). Good fit in my ears and elegant design. Conclusion: if there was ANY way to make them work as intended, I'd keep them. I'd buy again from Anker if they solve the connection drop issue. I also bought same day a big over-the-ear Q20 - very happy with those.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor
customer_reviews.text: They would not fit my ears properly. Tried every tip yet they always felt loose. The sound quality isn’t great. I’ve a pair of wired headphones that cost £29 that sound way better. There are too many options & settings. Total frustration. I really looked forward to these. I read all the reviews. I read all the instructions. They are crap. Ive worked for Richer Sounds for 20 years. Bluetooth headphones can be very good but definitely not under £150.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and ckear
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good blue tooth headset and after trying other brands I found I was replacing them frequently due to different issues such as poor signal, sound or interfaces. Anker have ticked all the boxes with this headset. The sound quality is excellent and can be tuned specifically to your hearing. Noise cancellation does help to reduce background noise, but they do not completely cancel everything. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Cerberus

customer_reviews.title: My go-to wireless earphones.
customer_reviews.text: There are great wireless earphones. No ANC but it does isolate very well. It's crucial to use the correct size ear tips to get good seal and therefore great sound quality. These are my go-to earphones and I use them for working out, telephone calls etc. I have run with these and they have never fallen out of my ears. They work on cellular calls and WhatsApp mobile calls. They charge up via USB-C and have wireless charging too. The touch controls work with a beep to acknowledge your press. The actions are fully customisable via the app. For the money, I don't think you can get better balance of features and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Juinn

customer_reviews.title: Great when they work, but let down by a quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my daughter, principally used for jogging. Excellent design and sound quality, but she has now had two pairs which each developed a faulty bud (the first refused to charge after c.3 months, for the second one the sound failed after one use). So there is something not quite right with build quality/consistency. Cannot fault Amazon returns though.
customer_reviews.author: R. H. London

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough but very dodgy touch controls
customer_reviews.text: Good: - Quality feel and construction for both buds and case. - Good fit, seal outside noise and provide god bass with the correct size tips. - Case keeps its charge very well. - Sound is pretty good. Bad: - I use my Bose earbuds with iPad and/or iPhone seamlessly and simultaneously - not possible with these. - TOUCH CONTROLS: maddening!! e.g. try to double-tap to turn off, they immediatey dial a completely random contact, not even someone from my recent calls. An old school button would have been better (again, see Bose).
customer_reviews.author: RichieT

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone , Beware
customer_reviews.text: 1. The product that i got was not new but previously opened. 2.Left ear piece disconnects and it’s a hassle to re-pair 3. Heavy in the ears and fall off aswell , good luck i have perfect reflexes and i catch them . 4. Took me 5 mins to hate them because sound is low , rubbers feel awful in the ears . Re-packaged for Re-turn , however don’t know how as all return offices are closed so i guess will wait for this Covid situation to pass for me to print the label and return. Amazon understood the situation entirely and prolonged the return time .
customer_reviews.author: George-Ionut Albici

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, great battery life, maybe don’t run with them
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ear buds, I use them for music and calls at work and at home. It took a bit of experimenting to find the right size ear buds. But once in they are pretty secure. I might not want to run with them though. I have only managed to run out of batteries once (on a 6 hour phone call!!) The case is also quite satisfying to dock the buds in and never opens accidentally in your pocket. Swapping between sources of sound is pretty simple. But the Soundcore app seems to only work on one device. Overall, pretty good, I’d happily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Top job for calls
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife who loves long phone calls with friends. This one had the best reviews for phone calls so I went for it. She is very pleased with them, and has yet to flatten them on one marathon phone call so I guess they get tops marks for their intended roll! However, she did report that very occasionally there is a brief break in audio, but it is very quick and doesn't drop the call. If you are a music lover though you might want to consider this. I think it would drive me mad personally but they weren't chosen for me.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound 1 very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: OMG these have to be the best ear phones I have ever owned and that's saying something, instructions are easy to follow to set up even the reset function as 1st time I tried only 1 ear worked 🙈 quick reset and set up following instructions and both are working great . Very clear sound , I set up using the personalised hearID (think that's what it is called) all in all I love these even better then the buds+ I got with my s20 , also very comfy they stay in well as most others earphones I have had kept falling out thats not a issue I have now 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Best ones bought so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been through numerous wireless Bluetooth earphones over the past few years, but I was looking for something to mask the in-cabin aircraft noise, and being a long-time fan of Anker's portable battery chargers, I thought I'd give these a try. Although no sound expert, I have to say I'm really impressed with this product, and my thanks go to a co-reviewer for his excellent advice on how to pair these with my phone, his instructions work a treat. I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Muddyeagle

customer_reviews.title: Honest review
customer_reviews.text: Wow got these delivered today and have been using it all day. Firstly these buds have a premium build quality, secondly the sound. I am no audiophile but the sound quality in these buds are are premium the sound is loud crisp and clear. Having both the Sony wf-1000xm3 and the jabra elites 75t these bugs give those a run for their money at this price range this are the best bugs you can get and I dare to say for the price alone these are better than the sony's and jabra's earbuds.. Overall excellent value for money highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you making calls otherwise good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: mine are very comfortable to ears but call quality is very bad . Person can here everyone and everything else except my voice from other end , you have to scream all the time when calling . Otherwise sound quality is very impressive. Sometimes female voices can be very harsh ear hurting .
customer_reviews.author: pronoy

customer_reviews.title: Utterly Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed with these after all the hype ... Write ups , Diamond Coated this and that ... One earbud just didn't work at all and the other auto-connected and just seemed to play music from any library or audiobook at random ... Maybe I was unlucky and got sent a duff set but it was an easy and instant decision to send them back ... Anything else that I have tried has been Way Better than these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacking Bass
customer_reviews.text: Got these for work to replace some existing Philips wireless earbuds. Although the device was of very nice quality (perhaps the buds felt a bit on the heavy side), the music quality in my opinion was a bit sub par for an RRP or over £100. Even after messing about with the EQ settings on the app, the sound stage still felt a bit shallow and the bass was definitely lacking comparing to my existing £65 pair of Philips (not being bias).
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Really love these they fit my ears nicely and they look great. Love the charging pod, the battery on the earpods and the charding pod last a long time respectively. Great for use on the phone (make sure you update them) and connect easily. Amazing clarity of sound, but probably a bit better for voice than music. They have a crystal clear sort of treble which is nice, but I'm used to more bass than middle and treble for my earpieces.
customer_reviews.author: Posthumously19

customer_reviews.title: Good with some minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: They are great alternatives to AirPods. The call quality is on par with AirPods (based on over 50 conference calls). Sound quality is fantastic at low to medium volume. Punchy bass with good mids and highs. At high volumes, they sound distorted. I only wish they had ambient mode include. The app is a breeze to use and I had no connection issues. I ended returning them because I could not get a good fit with the tips provided.
customer_reviews.author: Superfox

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I thought they'd be a good alternative to wearing a headset all day on work calls. Unfortunately my colleagues reported the microphone was pretty poor and sounded a bit like I was in a helicopter. In terms of fit they seal pretty well in your ears but wouldn't stay in for exercise. Probably ok for walking. Sound quality isn't too bad for the size/price. After 2 weeks one of the buds refused to power on so that was the trigger to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: I had a choice of either this or the RHA Trueconnects and I picked this. It's light, fits well, works independently left or right ear, and seems to have a stable connection. Also the microphone is really good. Constant WFH conference calls and it handles well. I switch between the left and right ear pieces to charge. But, even with the EQ controls, I can't seem to get the sound to sound as good as RHA MA390's though. But for what it's worth, it's good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Chen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, absolutely worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the money! Could do with some refinement on the gestures as they only work around 80% of the time. Clear, loud , crisp sound, easy to clean, Deep bass and very light and comfortable despite being a little thick to the look. LOADS of eq presets to suit your preferences (my experience with hear ID was really bad) The pairing process is easy and works instantly as soon as I open the case. I can leave my phone up to 50m away at work in an open warehouse and have no connection issues, the range is brilliant. The sound really isnt great with just one ear bud in. But really makes up for it when you wear both.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I have a faulty unit, but controls only occasionally work, temperamental!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly happy with sound quality, feels like a well made and refined product. However the controls are just too temperamental, often find its easier to take out player than to try play/pause from headphones. Take out the right earphone and player pauses (not sure if this is design or fault) which is super useful, but the it randomly starts playing again whilst in my hand? Brought mainly for use while exercising, but find no matter which bud I use, they just don't stay in ear, even with mild jogging. Fine if sat down or walking, maybe I just have weird ears?? Overall a nice classy unit, just not performing as I'd hoped, maybe it's a faulty set?
customer_reviews.author: mr a bostan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my listening habits
customer_reviews.text: First pair developed strange crackling sound just days of purchase when listening to spoken audio. Since I mostly listen to podcasts and audiobooks this was a big issue. Support agent offered some tips, but as it didn’t help they quickly sent me a replacement, which works perfectly. I like the customization of controls via the app, allowing me to easily pause, skip back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Diyan

customer_reviews.title: Some connection issues
customer_reviews.text: if you hold the voice assistant button it starts cutting out and then you have to repair it to get it working again. Don't know if it was just mine but i returned it, wouldn't recommend it to be honest, I've bought the galaxy buds now and so far I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Suhail

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe these other reviews giving these headphones 5 stars are genuine. What utterly terrible headphones! Sound quality is horrid. Fit is adaptable but all fits don’t feel right. Pairing is tricky and one of the headphones doesn’t work half the time. For another £20 I should have just got AirPods, they sound thousands of times better and just work. They look great and the case they are held in feels nice, but that’s about it. Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Better than AirPods
customer_reviews.text: For me these are a little gem. They sound incredible for the price and in my opinion are miles ahead of the AirPods. Full wireless charging paired with three indicator lights means you don’t have to guess how much juice they have. The eartips get some getting used to as they are different to your average silicone tips. Once the right ones are on though they are amazing. Bass is punchy and tight, mids highs and lows are all right and present and keep on going. Overall a great buy and you can buy nearly three pairs of these for one pair of AirPods.
customer_reviews.author: Adam James

customer_reviews.title: sound quality (music) not as good as i hoped
customer_reviews.text: ok, not sure if i was expecting too much and cant tell if my hearing is the best but the trouble on these seem to harsh for my taste... I can only compare it to some cheap earbuds I already had and these are definetely better but on the other hand I get much nicer sound from proper overear wired headphones (that cost not much more) I will keep them as I cant justify airpods etc and I mostly use them for podcasts and phone calls which are they are fine for.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Moalem

customer_reviews.title: Call quality seems 50-50, but noise cancelling is great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily for phone calls. That seems to be about 50-50. Some folks report that the call quality is very good, others report that it's crackly. Noise cancelling seems good as no one on the other end has reported hearing background noise around me. There also the odd issue of the call audio alternating between the two earbuds, but that's infrequent.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Mani

customer_reviews.title: Solid fully wireless set
customer_reviews.text: Overall the headphones are quite decent and can be had at a bit of a discount. Packaging was great, the app is OK. Good EQ settings available, not too much button customization. Pairs to 1 device at a time only. Sound quality is OK - separation is not great, heavy on the bass, they go really loud. Call quality is surprisingly great - you can both hear and be heard very well + you can use only one at a time if you want to. The case is nice and seems to have good battery life too. No active noise cancellation but they are in-ear, so there is some passive cancellation there.
customer_reviews.author: Diyan Mitev

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product but I paid the extra for a new item due to the current pandemic and not wanting an item that has bee used and I received a used set. The charging cable was missing and the items in the box weren't in properly and was clearly used.. great product but a major let down in practice. I've now paid extra for a used product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Having bought several Anker products in the past I expected these to live up to their high standards. Disappointed that they would not pair and that one bud seemed dead despite fully charging. Returned to Amazon but would be happy to review another pair if asked to. I also have both Bose and Agtershokz ear phones
customer_reviews.author: GAM

customer_reviews.title: Great balanced wireless earphones for under £100
customer_reviews.text: Received via Prime today, i have tried a number of headphones and earphones and from what i read about these were contenders over my daily drivers the Bose Soundsport Free. Bose seem to have a balanced signature eq written into there products. Updated and fitted these tried a few tracks from Spotify and Youtube. All sounds great with bass, and clarity of all instruments in the tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Borson

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall it does exactly what is described, sound and bass are excellent, abit large for the ear but fits in pretty good compared to the skullcAndy wireless earphones, Fairly comfortable and stays in ear at all times, noise cancellation could be improved as a tight seal is needed mostly once pushed in ear, works better when both pieces are used
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this! brakes my heart to send them back
customer_reviews.text: I'll be fair. I LOVE THIS PRODUCT My time with it was short and sweet. Sounded great, felt great and all round loved the controls. But alas, they didn't want to stay in my ears, no matter what ear tips I used. I blame my ears, but also the rubber tips. XD If your ok with the rubber tips, 100% worth a buy
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: SO impressed with these ear buds!
customer_reviews.text: First off, really nicely designed. matt black rubberised case and black buds look great. i watched a lot of reviews on earbuds before purchasing these, and i'm not disappointed. Great sound quality, with plenty but not over barring amount of low end. the in ear design works well for securing the ear bud, do find that i have to get the angel just right for the best sound. was slightly annoying at first but now i'm used to it, i find them easy to use. the EQ preferences are pretty good, with noticeable changes to suit any ear.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nathan Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These have definitely gotten better over time through software updates from the Soundcore app. They are really comfortable and there are 5 sets of different ear tip sizes so there should be a size for everyone. Really good battery life, connect to phone quickly after opening case, and the Bluetooth latency (sound delay, more noticeable when playing games or watching films) is less compared to Galaxy Buds+. I always buy Anker and I will continue to buy Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and comfort for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife and she is very happy with them. You get a bunch of different size tips so it shouldnt be too hard to find the right fit for you. The app is good telling you battery life, letting you customize EQ and update the earphones. Our first pair wouldnt update firmware, we got in touch with the MF and they arranged a replacement which when we got we were then able to update the firmware on the new model they provided. All in all happy with this product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrad Yardley

customer_reviews.title: Clear listening.
customer_reviews.text: Very clear, detailed sound although not as full as described: the bass tones are too shallow. The app to adjust equaliser settings is good but cannot provide the full sound I was hoping for in any scenario. I’m told by call recipients that my voice sounds clear but very tinny so, again, falling short of the tonal quality expected.
customer_reviews.author: Barney Gee

customer_reviews.title: One of the best earbuds on the market.
customer_reviews.text: These buds are awesome. So clear. Connection with phone is simple and reliable. There’s been no lag. The HearID is very clever. I recommend that is used in set up then giving you a bespoke hearing experience. Would definitely recommend. Having a range of tips to choose from (Xs to Xl) is great. Allows you to sample all sizes and get ones that fit and provide the perfect seal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ross A Stupart

customer_reviews.title: Best earphones I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously ordered a random brand pair off amazon and returned them because they cut out and the battery life was horrible. Decided to give the Anker Soundcore ones a try after my other half said the over ear ones were amazing. Cannot fault them at all the case is well made and small enough to carry around without realising its on you. Sound quality is top notch and so far, haven’t needed to recharge the case after 4 days. Would recommend them to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Mark J T

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bit of a strange review this as I had to send them back as they didn't fit my wife's ears but when I had a play about with them, was amazed at the sound quality for the price. Easily connected to my phone and found the experience really good with a surprising loud bass and noise cancelling properties. I would have kept them for myself if not for fact I already have a good pair of wireless buds.
customer_reviews.author: Grampian Champion

customer_reviews.title: Great value, superb sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Had these for 3 days now and am well impressed. Battery life and recharge time seems good, build quality is excellent and the sound quality is outstanding. They were easy to pair and the app control allows easy customisation of the sound to suit your tastes. They were very comfortable on a 9 hour flight yesterday. All in all my early impressions are very positive and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: The Sceptic

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I have upgraded from the original soundcore Liberty Airs. These are a game changer. The sound quality is excellent, pairing is easy and the new app just tops it off. These can be used as single earbuds which is great for my work. The case isvery good quality and the wirless charging works a breeze. These are definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Mr S Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Solid pair of earphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Sound is great - Touch controls (can also be customised in the app, although more options would be nice) - HearID worked quite well and lots of equaliser settings to choose from in the app Cons: - The silicon earbuds were a bit weird and made sound while moving. Had to replace them with other ones I had. - The design seems to suction cup inside my ear and makes it feel like I've gone through a tunnel if I move my head around.
customer_reviews.author: Rory James Croucher

customer_reviews.title: Dare you to find a better pair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound and call quality, nice and compact. No active noise cancellation but the rubber tips will keep the sound out. The app is great for finding your personal EQ and for customising the touch options. I have put my own custom tips on that I had from another pair of buds that work best for me but the supplied tips also work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Grafton

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant headphones half the cost of AirPods
customer_reviews.text: Honestly was trying to decide between these and AirPods and I thought well if I’m going to spend this much on headphones I might as well get good ones and these Anker Liberty Air 2’s are brilliant. They sound balanced and with the EQ App sound even better. Noise cancellation is great especially when I’m on the train to London and the battery is incredibly good. Buy these you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Marley Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set of buds
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality and a very good battery life. By keeping the storage/charging box nearby, the downtime due to lack of battery is next to nothing. Initially I found the sound a little less bassy than I'm used to but with the correct buds installed and actually listening out for the nuances in a track rather than just a booming bass I've realised that my judgement of good sound was a bit distorted prior to getting these excellent buds. I've never tried them for exercise hence the 3*, that's not meant to indicate that they failed, just that I didn't try them. They're not actively noise cancelling, just a good fit in the ear, hence the 4* for that..
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: blown away!
customer_reviews.text: so I don't review many products, but after trying fake AirPods and then buying AirPods(gen1) and they died!, I saw a few resent you tubers review these, unbox therapy and Linus tech tips. I thought i'd try them, after Anker emailed me a discount code for their products, got these for £69.99 from amazon. downloaded their app for iOS. and wow i'm truly blown away, the sound is brilliant! quick connection to iPhone once the lid is open, and can easily switch between MacBook and iPhone without hassle. I'd say these are a lot better than most Bluetooth earphones. the fit is great come with mediums buds connected, but also come with S/L/XL/XXL. battery life is great. very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Tom Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product backed by excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Jan 2020, very pleased with them and used daily However in September the right bud stopped connecting & I contacted Soundcore for help They suggested a couple of things to try, neither of which worked, but told me if this was the case to send them a short recording of the issue I did this at 11pm one evening and awoke to an email confirming a replacement pair were on the way - arrived 6 days later Products like this can go wrong, and quibble free service like this makes me more likely to be a repeat customer
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good phones.
customer_reviews.text: Personally never used AirPods but I would assume this is a great choice to replace them. Great sound and even better the price. Also having a usb-c charging port is useful and even better being able to charge wirelessly. They provide great sound and battery life lasts for a long time. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Silva

customer_reviews.title: Not worth
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, these headset are not worth that price tag. The Bluetooth drops randomly, others, it is connected to the phone but they do not work. Most annoying part of owning these headphones is the touch bar works with anything that touch this includes if you wear hat. You will not be able to listen as it skip whenever,something touchs. The battery does not last no more than 1 or 2 hours continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: cabaas

customer_reviews.title: Better Audio, Battery life & Durability
customer_reviews.text: Better sound and battery life for much less than other major brands earbuds. Great audio for the price Adaptive listening features Excellent microphone quality Solid battery life across the board with wireless charging Reliable connectivity Quick and wireless charging
customer_reviews.author: Vimal

customer_reviews.title: Anker not as good as it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure why people are praising Anker customer service. I've been asked to return a clearly faulty pair of earphones at my own expense? How is that fair considering most sellers provide a prepaid return label.
customer_reviews.author: Mustapha Riaz

customer_reviews.title: Delivery driver
customer_reviews.text: As a delivery driver i needed something that would block out background noise without spending too much. I brought different ones before and they were rubbish then i found these & im so pleased with them! I was driving at 40mph, with window open and my husband thought i was still at home as there was no background noise to suggest i was in the car! Sound on both ends are crystal clear. I would definitely recommend for someone who is out and about all day 😊
customer_reviews.author: Jess Duffield

customer_reviews.title: Right earphone is dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: --- UPDATE --- Anker replaced the earphones and they work great. * The sound is amazing * Easy to set up and use * the phone app useful to set the sound color you like Recommended I rarely review and almost never gave one star, but when you ship a faulty product you give me no options. The right earphone does not work. As you see in the picture the left earphone has a white solid light but the right one is dead. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and perfect replacement for my other souncore headphones
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back my original Soundcore Anker in ear headphones as one of the buds totally stopped working so thought best invest in an upgrade. What a bloody good idea aswell. Quality is so much better. Very sturdy, qood quality product. Charges very quickly and allows for simple use. Easy to set up as well with one touch settings.
customer_reviews.author: adam has

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk
customer_reviews.text: It's almost impossible to pair these to more than 1 phone, tablet, laptop, etc. Every time I try to swap between phones I need to factor in 30 minutes to battle my way through the pairing process. Only buy these if you're happy to only ever use them with a single device
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these are great and with the app the sound can be adjusted to suit your personal taste. The battery life is also good but there is no active noise cancellation
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Sound bad, even after tailoring through the app
customer_reviews.text: These earphones created a really painful seal in my ears - like all air sucked out. This did mean that they isolate outside noise really well, if that is what you're looking for. However, they sounded pretty bad for music, even after tailoring the sound through the app. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money. Superior sound
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! They produce beautiful sound and even come with an app that tests your hearing and adjusts the sound Accordingly. Just beware: read the instructions before pairing the very first time. The work in Mono mode and if you don’t follow the steps you can end up only pairing one not the other. If that happens, I suggest to check the instructions to Reset and also set Forget this Device on your phone. Then start over.
customer_reviews.author: O. L. Juhasz

customer_reviews.title: Anchor sound core liberty air 2 true wireless earphones
customer_reviews.text: Great product. But purchased these because I know of bankers reputation and sadly we had a minor issue with connection rang anchor spoke to an American FAITH, in China (incredibile knowledge) had the headphones sorted in a jiffy. Anchor and their backup system 2nd to none.
customer_reviews.author: Snowey

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant ear buds excellent bass and great for long distance running
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I LOVE these ear buds I cannot believe how deep the bass is! Call quality is great. Yesterday went for a 10km run and usually cannot run with earphones they stayed in the whole time and for a 90 min call I took right after still doused in sweat. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 wireless earphones
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with these earphones. I found them easy to sync on my iphone, iPad & Lenovo laptop. I have used them on Zoom business meetings, telephone calls, listened to music & streamed video, but not used them for working out as that’s not my thing. The sound quality is outstanding. They keep their charge well too. Definitely a 10/10 for me.
customer_reviews.author: Franzeska Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build quality, excellent audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these Earbuds, especially at this price and when I purchased they had a 20% off voucher at amazon checkout, and an offer on a wireless charging pad too, so look out for that also. Not quite all the features of the high end Apple buds (no ANC in these) but for music and calls until I decide which high end buds to purchase (when is a manufacturer going to combine all the things we need in one device?) the quality of the product build, and audio is way better than I imagined. Worth watching a YouTube review or two if you’re unsure.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my Jlab ones as they were hurting my ears but other than this con my old ones work better in all areas. First off they look good but that's about as far as I'd go for the pro's. Right ear piece sounds muffled constant, high frequencies are terrible and lastly it cancels near to nothing out around me. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent call quality, nice fit in ears, not bad, recommended 5*
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, the call quality is the best and very good, there are a couple settings for calls but didn't really get into that, there is a application for the headphones which is good as you can change the buttons as you please to change pause and music up down next ect, also very good fitting in ears doesn't fall out unless you put them in loosely, I recommend definately if it is on discount
customer_reviews.author: M A

customer_reviews.title: My first wireless earphones. Really happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: These were the first wireless earphones I've ever bought. I wanted an alternative to buying AirPods and after some online research and watching reviews I decided to go for the Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2. I don't have anything to compare them to however I can find no faults. They are black which I much prefer as they are not so noticeable when in ear. Sound quality brilliant, using the app I found a sound profile that worked for me which is great. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ewan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: First pair I bought would not update firmware. Very frustrating. Contacted customer services and they were extremity helpful. Did all the suggested trouble shooting and still didn't work. After sending them proof of purchase they agreed to replace them straight away. I sent them back, they reimbursed my postage, and I had a new pair within a few days. Which work great. And the customer service was excellent. The headphones themselves are great for the price. Great connection. Phat bass. Good touch controls. Stay in when running. Fun to play with the equaliser on the app. For the price. Cant go wrong. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Anker sound core Liberty earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Brought for partner. He's very happy with them. Good quality, sound and fit. Purchased on an offer very good value for money
customer_reviews.author: millie2332

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Just to clarify the following review is a duplicate as this is the third pair I have bought, one for each of the family. These are great, sound quality is excellent. This is the first pair of noise cancelling ear buds I have had and it is amazing. I am not qualified to comment on battery life as I never use them long enough to drain the battery and I have nothing to compare it to but I have no complaints. They are easy to connect and they are comfortable and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constant static noise and bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I've only just got these, but they have a constant hissing/static noise which is really annoying. If you will only play loud music on them I doubt it will matter, but for softer sounds its definitely distracting. Edit: After using these a bit more, I think rather than getting a defective pair, the quality is just really bad. My £15 (wired) earphones are far better quality, don't produce a constant static noise, and are more comfortable in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: These were great to start with, however after less than a month of use the auto pause feature when removing from my ear has failed on one headphone... Not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Matt Whittle

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of buds!
customer_reviews.text: Having used these regularly for several months I can safely say these were a good buy; the fit is snug thanks to the various earbud sizes and the touch commands are very useful. For the most part the Bluetooth connectivity is flawless however it isn't without its faults. It won't ever randomly disconnect, however, sometimes switching from one earbud to the other can cause problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Brought these for my son and he loves them. He had had them for nearly 2 weeks now and uses them a couple of hours each day and still one 90% off the first charge. there comfortable to wear and easy to pair with devices. Sound quality it fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for music. But overall they are 👍
customer_reviews.text: I was on the verge of return these, the sound was horrendous, the highs were ear piercing and no bass of any sort. But I re installed the Bluetooth connection and reset the buds, the sound for music much better. I generally prefer the sound of my shure 215 better but these are acceptable, especially at the discounted price but not at full price (I'd have returned them). Having said all that, calls are great and for the purposes of wearing for workouts again, great. One final niggle the touch controls are a bit fiddly for me to use well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P.

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds are huge!
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are huge! I'm a female and even with the smallest tip this didn't sit in my ear properly and kept falling out. I returned these and got the Huawei Freebuds 3 instead and they're so much better in terms of fit! I had reservations anyway about inear buds because they never quite fit properly and I was right this time! If anyone has the same reservations and contemplating between the two different earbud designs, and is an Android bbay, go for the Huawei Freebuds 3! Can't comment on the rest of the features unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are terrible. They don’t stay in your ear at all! I tried all the different sized ear buds, thought I’d figured it out with one size as the sound quality improved and they stayed in on my commute, but as soon as I tried to use them for a work out they fell out every 10 seconds. Bought them after losing my AirPods as I was trying to save money, should have just paid for the AirPods again as I’m now going to have to get them anyway. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Henry T.

customer_reviews.title: Overall, amazing
customer_reviews.text: Anker is my “go to” brand for any iPhone accessories. Saw a few YouTube videos comparing these to AirPods Pro and people were saying the sound on these are amazing. I’ve had them for only 2 days, but the sound is amazing. I’ve used them on my phone and tablet, and also while jogging. Very comfortable fit, plus you get a very nice selection of different sized buds which is really good. Case is really good quality, and solid build. The earphones themselves are very good build and don’t feel flimsy. Overall, definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rickesh Patel

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, but not suited for me.
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING. Love the feel, sound quality --especially with the app as you can adjust it --but... My ears aren't built for these. They keep slipping out over time and I wish I got over-the-ear for the gym. If I grin too hard they nearly fall out no matter what eartips but, the sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Good noise cancellation. As a cyclist, great to be able to use just one bud at a time. Was very bummed out when I realized I'd put one of the buds through the washing machine but then very pleasantly surprised to find it had survived! Not as good as other headsets when switching between devices, essentially requires repairing, but at least this is easy to do with a consistent and reliable method by simply holding the button on the case whilst the buds are docked. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Feargal

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item as I needed earbuds to for when I potter about doing stuff at home. They were problematic from the get go. Firmware would not update, it was giving me a pop up saying error always at 72% complete. Went through all the guidelines, putting them back in case resetting and starting again but the same error. Giving up on that I tried to pair them with my samsung a50, sony nw 45 and my iPod and it was always the right bud that would connect and never a connection with the left. Returned them within 3 hours of getting them.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find earbuds that have decent audio quality with a decent microphone. I have tried 5 different makes all twice the cost of these Anker and all have been sent back as not fit for purpose. These Anker have a decent sound from the earpiece and have a reasonable microphone, they have the best combination that I have found and they are half the price. Work with Android phone, laptop with built in Bluetooth 5 and the new Asus Bluetooth 5 USB interface.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the product, the setup was easy and the sound impressive. Buds then stopped connecting. I followed instructions to disconnect and forget device, then to reset and pair. Did this multiple times with no luck. No led showing at all on right bud. Very disappointing. Have spent a day trying to reset and pair, to no avail. Contacted Anker and will await the response but currently I’ve lost trust in this product. This is the first problem I’ve ever experienced with and Anker product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Improve touch control
customer_reviews.text: My ones are bit of trouble when I used the double tap for the Volume up & down I try a different ear tips to fit my ears To see if works better but still have the the issue for the volume. So have to used my iPhone or my Apple Watch to control the Volume. I don’t know if I touched to hard or to soft but I’m no happy with the earphones about the touch system. And also I have a crack on my right earphone and is only one months since I bought the
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Jacome

customer_reviews.title: Great update to Liberty Air but weight of buds is an issue
customer_reviews.text: Liberty Air 1 was great but sometimes had connectivity issues with Bluetooth. Liberty Air 2 was a significant improvement but the buds are much heavier and they fall out easily. I have tried every combination of the silicone tips (including those from the Liberty Air 1) and they dont stay on. Really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Vinoth

customer_reviews.title: Totally amazing in every way !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow I can’t believe these earbuds I have tried so many over the last year and a half and none of them had the sound and bass also comfort and to top it off the app Soundcore is fantastic I’m blown away by these more than worth the money I would of payed £100 for these and better than the apple AirPod pro’s !!!!! ££££
customer_reviews.author: carl flannaghan

customer_reviews.title: Better than Airpods
customer_reviews.text: Great set of wireless headphones. Use them daily when working. Good noise cancellation and with different size rubber seals, getting a good fit is easy. They connect quickly to my phone and you can use them separately. Put one in and listen, put the other in and it immediately goes to stereo, take one out and it goes back to mono. Just remember to use the app and take off auto pause in mono...
customer_reviews.author: d-lo

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds but Bluetooth Connection can be better
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great, battery life is great, only problem is the connection. Sometimes it disconnects on it's own, sometimes I can only connect one of them, sometimes it takes a long time to connect. They are great earbuds but the connection could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Good value wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I have been a loyal customer of anker products as I find them exceptionally good as opposed to the other generic minor brands on Amazon. These wireless earbuds did not disappoint. A significant feature for me is the wireless charging case and the form factor; the way the headphones are stored upright in the case. A minor inconvenience is the app you have to install on your phone to customise the controls, and your custom controls are not available when only using a single earbud.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Had to refund the very next day. Music dropped many times at home and workplace for unknown reason.
customer_reviews.author: Mudassar

customer_reviews.title: Broke within the first month of use
customer_reviews.text: This product worked very well for the first few weeks, but then the right ear bud would output any audio. It would connect, but nothing would play, while the left would. Now the left ear bud refuses to connect. I've done all the suggested restarting procedures but they don't work. If they lasted more than a month I would be very satisfiedd
customer_reviews.author: douglas

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you work out!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if you intend to work out while using. Any sweat at all can turn the earbuds off and on repeatedly, mess with the touch controls. After three months of moderate use the left earbud has stopped charged despite resetting and cleaning the charging contacts. Not the quality I expected for the price, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Collishaw

customer_reviews.title: So good I brought another pair!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic, awesome sound quality. Easy to use. I have small ears and they fit great, my husband has bigger ears (lol) and they fit him great too. The sound quality is sublime. Another fantasic Anker product!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant overall package
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of wireless earbuds at around the £100 range and these are by far the best out of all of them. Fantastic sound quality, very comfortable and the app is excellent too.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant and half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these for listening to music and the telephone sound quality both incoming and outgoing. They stay in whilst running. Charging case is very good too with wireless charging as well.
customer_reviews.author: PETER

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and sound...!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Great build quality and amazing sound. Only problem was my ears are a strange shape so no matter which tip I fitted the earbuds would not stay in. So now my daughter has a fabulous pair of earbuds and no problems with them dislodging. As I said it’s my weird shaped ears and not the product. Now I have to go looking for a good pair of over ear headphones......🙄😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good in all Aspects
customer_reviews.text: Well thought out, excellent build, full of features and they tick all the boxes for me. I've had better quality sound with some Sennheiser over-ear, but for buds they sound very good.
customer_reviews.author: dbinit

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Anker Product!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pretty happy with these. Battery life is great, they sound better than I expected, they charge pretty quick and battery life is good. Plus bought these on offer so I definitely got a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Kaan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the price was unbeatable for the specs that this product has. They look very nice and the sound quality is great yet having said that I don't use them daily but when I do they do the job they were meant to do. For some reason the right one keeps falling off but I've always have that problem with all the headphones I've owned. They certainly look more expensive than they actually were.
customer_reviews.author: Danut Gai

customer_reviews.title: Great Ear Pods
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on YouTube I decided to buy a pair of Liberty 2 and have to say they are a great pair of pods , the sound is amazing and not paying apple prices
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Bespoke to your own hearing made this go from average to amazing in 2 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say.... my first foray into Ankers TOTAL wireless earbud realm... So Earbud set up, easy! App download and setup easy! Noise cancellation not 'active' but the buds shut most out! Sound out of the box average! HOWEVER via the app with a very simple process is Ankers HearID; where the app maps out your earbuds sound quality to each ear individually thought a sound test and Bingo! fan bloody tastic! what a difference and easily as good as any product twice its price...
customer_reviews.author: Alex Young

product_meta.title: Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 Wireless Earbuds, Diamond-Inspired Drivers, Bluetooth Earphones, 4 Mics, Noise Reduction, 28H Playtime, HearID, Bluetooth 5, Wireless Charging, For Calls, Home Office
feature_bullets: Diamond-Inspired Sound: Inspired by the ultra-hard structure of diamonds, Liberty Air 2’s driver domes maintain their rigidity even when vibrating at high frequencies. Music is reproduced with a 15% larger frequency bandwidth for clear treble and 2× more bass.

Perfect for Home Offices: Each earbud is equipped with two microphones and cVc 8.0 noise reduction technology. Environmental noises are reduced by 60%, while 95% of your voice is retained so you sound louder and clearer on the other end.

Up to 28 Hours of Playtime*: A single charge gives you a full 7 hours of listening, while the charging case extends it to 28 hours of playtime. And when the case needs a power boost, simply set it down on a wireless charger.

HearID Technology: Take the test to create a custom set of EQ settings that are optimized for your ears. HearID maps your hearing sensitivity at multiple frequencies and intelligently analyzes the results to give you a truly personalized listening experience.
One-Step Pairing and Bluetooth 5.0 Connectivity: Liberty Air 2 wireless earphones use Bluetooth 5.0 for a fast, strong, and ultra-stable connection.

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
